text: hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with high heat seared salmon
I love pan-seared salmon but it is
really hard to do inside because it just
splatters everywhere and your house
smells like fried salmon for 14 days and
even the mailman kind of you know gives
you the look like man your house smells
like fish all right so to avoid all that
we're going to go outside with a
well-seasoned cast-iron skillet I'm
going to build a nice fire like I was
doing a barbecue but then I'm going to
move the grate and put the pan right on
the coals let it sit for five minutes
you want it smoking hot
all right so our pans preheating like I
said at least five minutes
the salmon only has salt in a tiny tiny
amount of vegetable oil I'm going to
place it skin side or what was the skin
side down that layer has a little more
fat to it then this side you're looking
at right now that rounded side is leaner
so I like to sear it even though it
doesn't look as good I like to sear it
with what was the skin side down you can
see all that fat sort of being pushed
out and that's what's giving it just a
great crust and a great sear the beauty
of this recipe is the super high heat
searing and that's why we're outside so
don't be afraid three minutes for these
are like eight ounce nine ounce pieces
of salmon so three minutes I'm going to
flip it and by the way if you get a few
black marks that's normal this thing's
red-hot don't worry about those that's
the same exact thing as if you had a
black grill mark on a traditionally
grilled salmon I'm going to flip it over
give it three minutes on the other side
I'm going to take it off the heat I'm
going to flip that over so the more
presentable side is up and we're ready
to eat
so that was three minutes per side again
you're gonna have to adjust of course
but that's an average and it's so
beautiful it has this really thin but
distinctively crispy crust then just a
really moist beautifully textured inside
I served it real simply with a little
fresh tarragon aioli I must have that

was really really good and even though
we only season with salt having it
seared in its own fat at that high
temperature just gives it a wonderful
wonderful flavor I think my favorite way

anyway hope you give that try all the
